speaker: Doctor
text: What other symptoms are you experiencing besides fever and altered mentation?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been sweating a lot and feel really rigid all over. I'm also feeling confused and disoriented.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any recent travel, particularly to areas known for infectious diseases?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't traveled anywhere recently. I've mostly been at home.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent illnesses or infections, such as a cold or flu, before this fever started?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent illnesses or infections. I felt fine until this fever started two days ago.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your skin, such as rashes or unusual spots?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any rashes or unusual spots on my skin. It looks normal to me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any exposure to sick individuals or animals recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't been around anyone who was sick, and I don't have any pets. I've mostly been keeping to myself.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any gastrointestinal symptoms, such as nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any gastrointestinal symptoms like nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea. My stomach feels fine.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent vaccinations or medications that could be relevant to your current symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent vaccinations. I'm currently taking haloperidol for my tics, but that's about it.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your muscle strength or coordination, such as difficulty walking or performing tasks?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any difficulty walking or performing tasks. I can move all my limbs normally, but I do feel really rigid.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any headaches, neck stiffness, or sensitivity to light?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any headaches or neck stiffness, and light doesn't seem to bother me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or experienced any unusual dreams or hallucinations?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my sleep patterns, and I haven't experienced any unusual dreams or hallucinations. I've just been feeling really out of it.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your mood or behavior, such as increased anxiety or agitation?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any significant changes in my mood or behavior, but I do feel a bit more confused than usual. It's hard to focus on things.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any muscle spasms or tremors in addition to the rigidity?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any muscle spasms or tremors, just the rigidity. It feels like my muscles are tense all the time.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent exposure to any toxins or chemicals, such as pesticides or heavy metals?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't been exposed to any toxins or chemicals recently. I mostly stay indoors and haven't done any activities that would involve those substances.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your vision or hearing, such as blurred vision or ringing in your ears?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my vision or hearing. Everything seems normal in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any chills or shivering along with your fever?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any chills or shivering. It's just been a steady fever without those symptoms.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent dental work or infections in your mouth that could be relevant?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent dental work or infections in my mouth. My oral health has been fine.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any difficulty swallowing or changes in your speech?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any difficulty swallowing or changes in my speech. Everything seems normal in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your heart rate or breathing, such as palpitations or shortness of breath?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any palpitations or shortness of breath. My heart rate feels normal, and I can breathe comfortably.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any recent weight loss or changes in appetite?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any weight loss or changes in my appetite. I've been eating normally despite feeling unwell.

speaker: Doctor
text: Given your symptoms of fever, altered mentation, rigidity, and the absence of other significant findings, I suspect a possible neurological issue. I would like to assess your neurological status further. REQUEST TEST: CT_Scan_of_the_Head

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: Maximum inferences reached

speaker: Patient
text: I'm still feeling really confused and rigid, and the fever hasn't gone away. It's been tough to focus on anything.
